NEW TIP: How Effective Is Your Landing Page

Ever wonder how effective your landing page really is? In today's tip you'll learn how to test your landing page with LeadPages Landing Page Grader. Be sure to follow the steps in each photo (the url for the test grader tool is in the first image).

On top of what this grader tools tells you to do, the success of your landing page will also increase if you:

☛ #1 build trust by repetition. Meaning, whatever content you're using in your ads, should match with the content of your landing page.

☛ #2 create landing pages with skimmable body copy. Make it easy for your audience to understand the benefits of your offer. Use bullet points!

☛ #3 use high quality images to make your page appealing.

☛ #4 make sure your call-to-action stands out and test different landing pages to learn what works.

☛ #5 add testimonials from happy customers.

I hope this tip is helpful! Thanks for your time! - Juan 😃. Photos from Social Media Examiner's post.

NEW Wednesday Tip: how to turn your Cover Image into a Compelling Marketing Banner! - Juan  

#1 Upload a Cover Image with dimensions 851 x 550 pixels (Facebook displays 315 pixels of the Image height, so part of the Image will be covered)
#2 Add a clear call to action to the part of your Cover Image that is covered (the additional 225 pixels in height). The whole Image with dimensions 851 x 550 px will be revealed if people click on your Cover Image
#3 Add a click Button to your Cover Image
#4 Include additional instructions in the description of your Cover Photo, plus the link that leads them to the landing Page

So, now whenever someone clicks your Cover Image they will be pleasantly surprised with a compelling freebie!

Would you like to make sure that any time someone shares your article on Facebook that your Page or Profile is linked to that article?  This is a GREAT way to grow your Page or your Following if you are blogging.  Author tags can help you accomplish this goal.  There are two ways to do it and I show both ways in this quick video.  

If you have the Yoast SEO Wordpress plugin (free), you can do it in 3 easy steps (covered in the video)  Access the Yoast plugin here: https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo/

If you need to do it manually, you can add these lines of code into your website either in the Header area or on individual articles (make sure you add your exact profile or Page links in replacement)
<meta property="article:author" content="https://www.facebook.com/yourprofilename" />

<meta property="article:publisher" content="https://www.facebook.com/yourpagename" />

Hope this was helpful and as always, share this video if you think someone else will find it useful! - Andrea. Hot Tip - How to Set Up Author Tags in Facebook.

HOT Tip: 3 Ways to Keep Your Facebook Page Secure

As Facebook Page owner or admin you most likely have invested a lot of time and effort to build your présence and grow your community on Facebook. You certainly want to protect this asset and prevent unwanted visitors from stealing your Facebook Page!

Here are 3 ways to keep your Facebook Page secure:

#1. Assign at least two Page Admins to your page. Whenever one of the Page Admins loses access to their Facebook Account, the other admin can still manage all aspects of a Facebook Page. Make sure you assign someone you can really trust! To learn more: https://www.facebook.com/help/274301846062270

#2. Turn on login notifications / alerts. This prevents strangers from logging into your Facebook account from any unknown browser or device without you noticing this! If someone hacks your account, you receive a notification from Facebook as soon as they login to your account! To learn more:
https://www.facebook.com/help/162968940433354

#3. Turn on login approvals. This adds extra security to your Facebook account. When someone hacks your account, they can not login to your Facebook account without receiving a special login code (send to your mobile phone via text message). To learn more:
https://www.facebook.com/help/www/148233965247823 

And to learn more about Facebook latest Facebook terms, check out  http://goo.gl/Cpg1Z8

We hope this was helpful! - Juan. Timeline Photos.

Hot Tip:  You can "test" your Image to find out if it will pass the 20% maximum text rule in Facebook Ads.  
Here's how to test your image:
1.  Go to the Text Overlay tool and upload your image:  https://www.facebook.com/ads/tools/text_overlay  
2.  Click on the boxes that have contain text (yes, this grid is unforgiving)
3.  If you have more than 20% of the area covered your ad won't be approved.  

*Sometimes logos or text on a product don't "count"  
*You may have to re-position your text so that it does not overlap two boxes when it could fit into one. 
While this tip isn't "new" we hear frequently from people who are not getting their ads approved due to too much text so save yourself some time and and test first! - Andrea. Timeline Photos.

Here's what’s new:

Hangouts is sleeker. Now updated with material design, Hangouts has a new look and feel: items respond to your touch in more intuitive ways and transitions between tasks are more fluid. 

Hangouts is simpler. The new Compose button makes it easier for you to start a new group or conversation. Our streamlined contacts list helps you find the right person quickly. And attachments have been revamped and simplified, so sharing—of emoji, GIFs, your location, even multiple photos at once—is a snap. 

Hangouts is faster. Whether you’re sending a quick message or video chatting with family, you don’t want hold-ups. We’ve been obsessively fixing bugs and speeding up message delivery to make Hangouts faster and more reliable. Bonus: less battery consumption.

Facebook has new PAGE Engagement Custom Audience feature in Ads Manager. Pic via Mari Smith. 

Do you have these yet? Mari Smith. Wowee, do you have Facebook's new PAGE Engagement Custom Audience feature in Ads Manager? This is awesome. 🤗 You can now create these specific audiences and use in your ad targeting:
🔹 People who visited your Facebook Page, regardless of the action they took
🔹 People who engaged with any of your wall posts or ads, including all reactions, comments, shares, link clicks or carousel swipes (neato, love this!)
🔹 People who clicked any available call to action button on your Facebook Page
🔹 People who send a message to your Facebook Page (jackpot, LOVE this one! I've been saying for a while, be sure to *encourage* your fans/audience to private message your Page. Use the NEW Messenger as a destination in ads. Include the short link, e.g. m.me/marismith - message me! Add the Messenger chat box on your page; get the code here https://developers.facebook.com/docs/plugins/page-plugin and change the tabs field to 'messages.' Plus, jump into dialogue when appropriate via the Message button on your public comments!)
🔹 People who saved your Facebook Page or any post from your Page (another jackpot; some people might not engage as much with your Page but maybe they are 'stealth' and save a bunch of your posts, especially if you share valuable content/OPC a lot! OPC = other people's content)

To understand more about how the new Page Engagement Custom Audiences work, check out my buddy Jon Loomer Digital's post here: http://www.jonloomer.com/2016/11/10/facebook-page-engagement-custom-audiences/

Do you have this feature yet? Facebook's other Engagement Custom Audiences include: Video views, interaction with Lead Ads, interaction with Canvas posts/ads.  

Let your peeps know - go ahead and share this, please! 😁👍🏻 Cheers!

Instagram has introduced improvements to their direct messages including threaded messages and sending content from your feed as a Direct message. 

"Threaded messages make it easier to go back and forth with the people you talk to the most. Instead of creating a new conversation every time you send a photo or video, your threads are based on the people in them — and your moments flow along naturally. We’ve also added the ability to name your groups, a quick camera feature to respond with a selfie on the fly, and larger-than-life emoji for when there are just no words.

Today’s updates also bring a brand new way to start conversations around what you see on Instagram. When you find something inspiring or funny, your first instinct is often to share it with friends who you know will appreciate it. Today, people do this by @-mentioning friends in comments, so much so that nearly 40% of comments include an @-mention. This update has made it easier to share content that you love." Instagram Introduces Improvements to Instagram Direct.

NEW Tip: How to Customize Your Facebook Link Post 

Facebook prefers a native link post [paste link in status update and let Facebook scrape the Image] over a photo upload with a link. 

Sometimes Facebook's scraper has issues getting a good picture out of a Post on your site or a third party site. One solution would be to pull in the right Image with Facebook's URL Debugger Tool https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/ If you paste the post url in this debugger tool, Facebook will recrawl your Website and fetch a new Image. 

But, there's another solution which allows you to upload your own Image and even add a custom Title and Description to your Facebook link Post. Have you noticed that the SAVE feature on Facebook now allows users to save links in PHOTO posts?! HT to Mari Smith! Mari Smith. Have you noticed that the SAVE feature on Facebook now allows users to save links in PHOTO posts?! Plus, you can now save  multiple links and tagged Pages in posts. This is all rather awesome! Initially, Facebook only allowed native link posts to be saved. 

What links can be saved (updated list): 

✯ Native link posts (i.e. with preview intact)
✯ Status updates with links (link preview removed) ◆
✯ Photo posts with links (yay!) ◆
✯ Any post with multiple links (option comes up to Save All) ◆
✯ Any post with an @ tagged Page(s) (Page gets saved) ◆
✯ Pages
✯ Places
✯ Music
✯ Books
✯ Movies
✯ TV shows
✯ Events

◆ Indicates updated feature.

NOTE: it's only the actual LINK that you are saving. You're not saving the whole post, status, photo, etc. But, Facebook does help you see where the original post came from with a 'via' link in your Saved area.

[UPDATE: (added 9.24.14 at 12pm PT) -- you can also save links from posts directly on any Page's wall and on any personal profile wall, too!! With the latter, of course, privacy settings prevail. You can only see content shared publicly or to friends if you're friends with that person.]

What still can’t be saved:

✯ Status updates with no links
✯ Photo posts with no links
✯ Video posts (but you can save links to YouTube or Vimeo videos)

I've updated this blog post to reflect the changes: http://www.marismith.com/5-things-businesses-need-to-know-about-facebooks-new-save-feature/

Keep in mind that one of the latest news feed algorithm tweaks now gives priority in the news feed to native link posts (vs. link posts with the preview removed and photo posts with a link in the description, such as this post is!). See this post for more info: https://www.facebook.com/marismith/posts/10152256609165009

Are you making use of the Saved feature? 

✅ To save links in this post, just click/tap the gray arrow in the top right of the post on desktop or mobile. (Btw, your saved items appear in a bookmark called 'Saved' on the left menu of your home page/news feed.)

8 Recent Changes to Facebook Ads

A great roundup by Mari Smith! - Erik . Mari Smith. 7 Recent Changes to Facebook Ads - get up to speed quickly with this roundup of new features and changes that may impact your advertising on Facebook! [Update: added #8 below!]

① MANAGE ADS ON THE GO

Advertisers can now manage ads with Ads Manager on mobile devices. Using your Facebook native app, look for the Ads Manager bookmark.
 
SEE: A New Way to Manage Facebook Ads on the Go via Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/business/news/manage-facebook-ads-on-the-go

② EVENT ADS

Previously, event ads were only shown in the right-hand column on desktop. Now pages can create event ads for desktop and mobile news feed. PLUS, event hosts can view insights directly on the event page. 

SEE: Facebook now lets Pages create News Feed ads to promote Events on desktop and mobile via The Next Web
http://thenextweb.com/facebook/2014/08/28/facebook-now-lets-pages-create-news-feed-ads-promote-events-desktop-mobile/

③ “BUY” BUTTON ON ADS

Facebook is testing a new “Buy” button on ads (desktop and mobile) and page posts. 

SEE: Facebook’s Buy button and the future of global commerce via InsideFacebook.com
http://www.insidefacebook.com/2014/08/19/facebooks-buy-button-and-the-future-of-global-commerce/
Also: https://www.facebook.com/business/news/Discover-and-Buy-Products-on-Facebook-Test

④ BANDWIDTH TARGETING

In order to more effectively reach people in high-growth countries, Facebook introduced bandwidth targeting to give advertisers the ability to place ads based on the quality of a user’s network connection (whether 2G, 3G or 4G+), whatever they most often use when accessing Facebook.

SEE: Facebook Turns On “Bandwidth Targeting” To Match Mobile Ads To Your Network Quality via TechCrunch
http://techcrunch.com/2014/08/27/facebook-turns-on-bandwidth-targeting-to-match-mobile-ads-to-network-quality/

⑤ NEWS FEED AD FREQUENCY DOUBLES

Facebook quietly altered its ad policy to allow brands to show the same news feed ad twice in a given day, whereas previously brands were only able to do so once per day. In addition, brands can show news feed ads twice daily (instead of once daily) to users who don’t already follow the brand, e.g. Suggested Posts. 

SEE: Facebook raises the frequency cap on ads via DIGIDAY:
http://digiday.com/platforms/facebook-frequency-cap/

⑥ CROSS-DEVICE REPORTING

Facebook introduced cross-device reporting to help advertisers understand how their mobile ads influence consumers’ desktop buying decisions. A Facebook blog post said that "a marketer can view the number of customers that clicked an ad on an iPhone but then later converted on desktop, or the number of people that saw an ad on desktop but then converted on an Android tablet."

SEE: Facebook Wants to Show That Mobile Ads Affect Desktop Purchases via Adweek
http://www.adweek.com/news/technology/facebook-wants-show-mobile-ads-affect-desktop-purchases-159486

⑦ FACEBOOK ADS RESTRUCTURE

Starting this month, Facebook is streamlining the ad process by rolling up all targeting and bidding to the Ad Set level. The new structure looks like this:
Campaign: Objective
Ad Set: Schedule, Budget, Bidding, Targeting and Placement
Ad: Creative

SEE: Facebook Updates Campaign Structure Again: New Ad Sets and Ads via Jon Loomer Digital
http://www.jonloomer.com/2014/08/19/new-facebook-campaign-structure/

⑧ MEASURE 20% TEXT IN ADS

Facebook added a grid tool to its Ads Manager to help page administrators determine whether their ads violate the 20 percent rule on how much text they can contain. (It's not clear if all advertisers now have access to this tool, or when it's coming). 

SEE: Facebook Adds Grid Tool to Ads Manager to Determine If Ads Violate 20 Percent Text Rule via AllFacebook.com
http://allfacebook.com/grid-tool-ads-manager-20-percent-text-rule_b134244

Facebook announced today that it will officially roll out Save to all users via the Web, iOS and Android “over the next few days.” Mari Smith. WOOHOO!! Facebook just launched a *SAVE* feature! Awesome news. It's a long-awaited way to bookmark content you see in your news feed so you can go back and read later. 

Facebook has been testing the new Save feature for TWO years!! The company finally announced today that it will officially roll out Save to all users via the Web, iOS and Android “over the next few days.”

✅  You can save items like links, places, movies, TV and music. 
✅  Save once, view anywhere (desktop, mobile).
✅  Your saved items list is organized by category.
✅  Facebook may show you reminders of your saved items at times.
✅  Only you can see the items you save unless you choose to share them with friends.

Wow, so exciting!! Buh-bye endless screenshots on my iPhone and posts shared to "me only" on my wall that I never return to. LOL!

What do you think? Will you use the new Save feature?!

FACEBOOK PSA: It seems FB has once again changed its rules for pages. So, here's the deal from what we're seeing around: A person has to be 'active' on your page a minimum of 3 times within any calendar month period. NEW Tuesday Tip: want to learn all the important sources of your Facebook Page growth? 

Here's how: 

a) download your Insights data on Page level for a specific time period (in this example we use last month)
b) next, open your downloaded Excel file and visit the second tab labelled 'Daily Like Sources'
c) select all data, copy it and 'paste special' all data in a new tab (make sure you check the option transpose data to paste all your columns as rows and vice versa)
d) include a new column at the end of your data sheet, and calculate the sum total for each row
e) sort your data by the last column (sum total) in descending order to learn which sources mainly drive your Page growth (likes)
f) use 'Facebook's API manual for Insights' to learn what each of these sources exactly mean (click Image below and scroll down to the end of this doc. - section Page Like Sources)

Hope this was helpful! - Juan

Hot Tip Tuesday:  Did you know that if you get blocked or deleted in one LinkedIn Group you are automatically marked for Sitewide Auto Moderation (SWAM) across all your LinkedIn Groups?  

What this means is that any future post you post within all your LinkedIn Groups will go into a moderated area where the group owner will have to "approve" it before the post is seen by anyone. And many group owners don't bother to check that area.  

To avoid this, use these tips when participating in LinkedIn Groups. You can also ask the group owner change your permissions (see this link for more info:  http://help.linkedin.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/38735)  

And make sure you join our LinkedIn group - we have lively discussions happening every day:  http://bit.ly/join-networking-club-on-LinkedIn  But make sure you read the Group rules :)  - Andrea. Timeline Photos.

BREAKING FACEBOOK NEWS! Facebook is set to launch Timeline for Brand Pages imminently, two sources tell us, with a possible official announcement on Feb. 29, one source says, when the social network holds its invitation only Facebook Marketing Conference.

!! What are your thoughts about Facebook Timeline coming to pages?! ~J Jakolien Sok. Boosting Your Brand. BREAKING FACEBOOK NEWS! Facebook is set to launch Timeline for Brand Pages imminently, two sources tell us, with a possible official announcement on Feb. 29, one source says, when the social network holds its invitation only Facebook Marketing Conference.

Facebook is already in the process of forcing Timeline on its individual users globally over the next few weeks. The next logical step is for that rollout to reach Brand Pages.

Timeline for individual users essentially redesigns your Facebook page, turning every status update and photo post into a single, long, visually appealing "narrative" of your life.

"At Facebook they pushed back the launch of Timeline for brands to the end of February," a source who has been briefed by Facebook ad sales executives told us. The source noted the Feb. 29 "fMC" confab, hosted by vp/global ad sales Carolyn Everson (pictured), and added "Those two pieces of information are too much of a coincidence."

The second source said, "Timeline is coming to Brand Pages," and added that many marketers remain ignorant of how it's going to work and how it may affect them. "Most people don't even know."
A Facebook spokesperson said: "...we believe that consistency in both functionality and appearance increase use of Facebook.  We hope to make Pages more consistent with the Timeline in the future, but we have nothing further to share at this time."

!! What are your thoughts about Facebook Timeline coming to pages?! ~Jakolien Sok

Discovery of the Week: Want an app to help you better manage and structure your time? Check out 30/30.

The app uses the philosophy behind the Pomodoro method: doing things in intervals, which helps you maintain focus on the task at hand. Essentially you do 30 minutes of work, and then take a 30-minute break (or whatever time period is reasonable for you).

The app has icons for email, books, music, photos, social networks, checklists, etc., that you can line up in personalized workflows. For example, set up 25 minutes of email and then have the next interval be a five-minute break, then repeat that email segment or begin another task segment such as checking Facebook or Twitter. Facebook Announces Conversion Lift To Help Marketers Better Understand the Impact of Facebook Ads

You’ll experience a unique event that brings you carefully recruited experts who live and breathe social media marketing every day. Only the best.

Your presenters include Guy Kawasaki, Mari Smith, Chris Brogan, Jay Baer, John Jantsch, Dave Kerpen, Sally Hogshead, Michael Stelzner, Lee Odden, Jason Falls, Jesse Stay, Mark Schaefer, Mario Sundar (LinkedIn), Cliff Ravenscraft, Joe Pulizzi, Marcus Sheridan, Ric Dragon, Brian Carter, Amy Porterfield, Nichole Kelly, Derek Halpern, Pat Flynn and experts from more than a dozen major brands—just to mention a few!
